reviews.review_msg: This class was very boring: each seminar had between 1 to 3 ten minute student presentations. Most students just read their presentations. The lecture portion, where Ryan actually showed his presence, was quite informative. So why make his students suffer through 10 to 30 minutes of non-informative student drizzle is beyond me.

Second course I've had with Ryan. He's a chill, laid back prof but has somewhat high expectations on his essays. Found the course itself interesting. He tries to be engaging and funny. Overall a pretty decent prof and I would take more classes with him.
She is a very nice woman; however, her classes are terrible. She fails to study any idea in depth and the ideas she chooses to look into during lecture are ridiculous...she is pulling at strings.

I have had him for 2 classes and look forward to having him again. He has great lectures and  I always look forward to them because they are so entertaining and engaging.  True Passion is in this man.  The books he picks are wildly entertaining as well. He welcomes feedback and questions.  But be prepared not to be spoon fed information.

One of the best profs--truly cares about your learning. Never having taken an ENGL course, she was extremely helpful and forthcoming. When asking for guidance, she provides extensive advice to help improve grades. Class had biweekly reading journals and 2 essays. Marking was fair though on the lower side.

It was a pleasure to take study Victorian literature with Dr. Lesjak.  Course material was delivered with energy, and readings were varied to challenge/suit most tastes.  Dr. Lesjak was very approachable.  She responded positively to questions, and provided copious and constructive comments on essays.  Hope to take more courses with her.
